rules: Rule1: If the Environmental Conservation Consortium receives government grant funding, then the Environmental Conservation Consortium conducts research on the wetland ecosystem

Rule2: If the Project Board monitors the progress of the Environmental Conservation Consortium, then should the Environmental Conservation Consortium conducting research on the wetland ecosystem not lead to the wetland ecosystem achieving conservation status, the Environmental Conservation Consortium halts the wetland restoration project
Rule3: If the Environmental Conservation Consortium publishes findings in a scientific journal, then the wetland ecosystem achieves conservation status

Rule4: If the University provides expertise to the Environmental Conservation Consortium, then when the Environmental Conservation Consortium conducts research on the wetland ecosystem, the Environmental Conservation Consortium publishes findings in a scientific journal
Rule5: Either the Local Community withdraws support from the Environmental Conservation Consortium or the University provides expertise to the Environmental Conservation Consortium
facts: Fact1: The Environmental Conservation Consortium receives government grant funding
Fact2: The Project Board monitors the progress of the Environmental Conservation Consortium
Fact3: The Environmental Conservation Consortium does not halt the wetland restoration project
Fact4: The Local Community does not withdraw support from the Environmental Conservation Consortium

question: The wetland ecosystem achieves conservation status
